page.title: 13MELSONBY-The Village Shop
page.content: Only{one shop}remains in the village, following the closure last year of a general dealers. Although small, this corner shop{caters for most needs}from the point of view of food (fresh and frozen), newspapers and magazines, drink (alcohol and others), and incorporates all{post office services. It is thus an{ important village {amenity} which must not be allowed to disappear in the same way that the vicarage, police house, schoolmaster's house and other shops have disappeared over the past 30/40 years. The shop is {open 7 days a week, although with {restricted hours of {opening}on{Sunday and Thursday.} Prices may be slightly higher than in the town supermarkets but the costs of transport to/from town cancels out any savings made on price. The personal service & convenience count much more.
